moves.1. d4:
This is why I lost the game...lol

I haven't played enough d4 games to know how to react :P
moves.1... d5 2. c4: Queen's gambit (just looked up the name...haha)
moves.2... Bf5: Focused on developing...not really sure what the standard moves are. I'm too lazy to read books and stuff.
moves.4... h6: Not sure why I did this. Perhaps to prevent Bg5 or Ng5
moves.5. Bf4: Developing bishop and placing it in a powerful position
moves.5... Bd6: Maybe Bb4 would've been a better move here (any insights?).
moves.6. e3: White's development is much further than black's. You would think I would focus on getting the knights out and finishing up my development ... but...
moves.6... Bxf4: Pikachu knows best...I don't really like so many white control on e5. And this doubles pawn on f-file for white.
moves.7... c6:
Usually I focus on developing knights before bishops...but like I said I was probably in a losing mood since 1. d4... haha

I should've probably focused on developing knights at this point
moves.9... Qd6: Okay, to anyone wondering why in the name of jellybeans I did this. I don't know. Usually when someone castles I start moving all my attacking pieces that way. This move was along those lines to attack the castle.
moves.11. Nf3: Moving back to a safe spot. Blocks the bishop at e2 though. Perhaps Nxf5 would've been a better move here.
moves.13... Qc7 14. Nh4: attacking bishop on f5 which is defending g4
moves.15. Nxf5: Taking out a bishop that's attacking a free diagonal, and doubles up pawn on the f-file
moves.16... Kd8: Not quite sure why I did this. Castling may have been a better move.
moves.18. b4: Not sure why this move was made. Maybe white wants to start attacking black's queenside?
moves.18... Na6:
Black finally develops the knight but to a useless square...duh

Should've probably gone to d7
moves.19... h4: attack on the castle...hoping to open the h-file
moves.20. Bxg4: Taking out another threat to the castle
moves.21. Re2: Perhaps to double up the rooks
moves.21... Kd7: Connecting rooks. I think Re8 may have been a better option
moves.22. Rae1: Doubled rooks on an open file...oh dear
moves.22... Rae8: I wanted to break the double rook since it's a much bigger threat than my connected rooks
moves.23. Qd2: This move was probably to get the queen to g5
moves.24. Nxe2: Getting material back while moving knight from a passive square...good move imo
moves.24... Qd8: I think this was to next move the queen to the h-file eventually
moves.27. Nd3: White's highly mobile knight is much more powerful than black's at this time.
moves.27... Qf6: Again with the h-file in mind. Plan was to get to f3 first
moves.29. a4: Not sure why this was done. Most likely to bait me to move f6 because I didn't see the next set of moves coming...
moves.31. Nd6+:
The Great Fork! I totally did not see this coming. At this point I thought with my poorly placed knight and black's rook on the open file I figured I did enough damage to my brain cells so I resigned. Maybe if I had kept on white would blunder which I could exploit, but seeing how the game had gone so far I think I would be more likely to blunder more ... lol

Thanks for reading if you have so far.
